Assigning User Licenses

In the application, users can have either named user or concurrent licenses. A named user license, sometimes called a fixed license, can be used only by the user who has been assigned that license. A concurrent license, sometimes called a floating license, can be used by any user who does not have a named user license.

Users without named licenses receive concurrent licenses on a first-come, first-served basis. After all concurrent licenses are in use, users attempting to log on are notified that no more licenses are available at that time. However you can, at any time, purchase more application licenses, as long as they are for the same level of functionality.

When you register the server, you enter one or two serial numbers: one for named user licenses and/or one for concurrent licenses. These licenses also define what components and features the server can provide for users.

After the server is licensed, named-user licenses can be assigned. The users to whom licenses are assigned must have already been added to the application. The Server Administrator is automatically assigned a named user license that cannot be removed. This license is not included in the number of named user licenses that you have available. It is a "free" license.

To assign a named user license:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged on, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens. By default, the All Users group is selected, and all user names are displayed in the Users pane.

  4. From the Users list box, select the names of the user to whom the license will be assigned.

  5. Right-click the name of the user to display a context menu.

  6. Select Add Named User License. An anchor appears before the user's name to indicate that the user has a named license.

  7. Click Close to exit the dialog.

To remove a named user license:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • Select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration from the client (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged on, you must do so before the dialog displays.  If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens. By default, the All Users group is selected, and all user names are displayed in the Users pane.

  4. Select the name of the user to be removed.

  5. Right-click to display a context menu and select Remove Named User License.

  6. Click Close to exit the dialog.

Tip: By looking at the status bar of the User Manager dialog, you can see how many of each type of license is in use.
